doc.after: The Scots mile was longer than the English mile,[29] as mentioned by Robert Burns in the first verse of his poem "Tam o' Shanter". It comprised 8Â (Scots)Â furlongs divided into 320Â falls or faws (Scots rods).[30] It varied from place to place but the most accepted equivalencies are 1,976Â ImperialÂ yards or 1.81Â km.[13][31]
